html: Figures recently out: - Pay up 3.2% in last year - higher than inflation - Unemployment halved since Labour left office (8% to 4%) - now lowest since 1975 - Over 3 million new jobs since 2010, 75% of which full time - Full time minimum wage post tax pay 44% up since 2010
text:
Figures recently out:
- Pay up 3.2% in last year - higher than inflation
- Unemployment halved since Labour left office (8% to 4%) - now lowest since 1975
- Over 3 million new jobs since 2010, 75% of which full time
- Full time minimum wage post tax pay 44% up since 2010

- Wages rising 3.1% annually, fastest for 10 years & higher than inflation

html: Willie Walsh, head IAG - which owns British Airways & Aer Lingus - says we should be 'sanguine' about Brexit. 'Brexit is inevitable. There are some issues that will need to deal with but it's not rocket science'. He's clear that planes will keep flying over Ireland
text:
Willie Walsh, head IAG - which owns British Airways & Aer Lingus - says we should be 'sanguine' about Brexit. 

'Brexit is inevitable. There are some issues that will need to deal with but it's not rocket science'. 

He's clear that planes will keep flying over Ireland

html: Gross EU contribuion £17b, less £4b rebate, less £4b for EU spending we will replace (mostly science reawarch and farm support) gives £9b. Half of the £39b divorce bill paid by 2021, so remaining half, or c£20b paid over 10 years = £2b per year. £9b less £2b gives £7b dividend
